name: Hot Coffee Grog
description: If there's been one simple message that's come out of the Four Loko hullaballoo, it's that mixing caffeine and alcohol is a bad idea. Now that this preliminary is out of the way, let's get down to doing that very thing. There are plenty of versions of the Hot Coffee Grog floating around in the booze world. Some contain cream or butter (or, in one tiki-fied version, coconut cream), and some are laced with a range of liqueurs.
recipeIngredient: 2 ounces Demerara rum: Lemon Hart and El Dorado 12 are good choices
4 to 6 ounces fresh-brewed coffee, to taste
1/4 ounce allspice liqueur (or 1/4 tsp. ground allspice)
1/2 ounce Jamaican rum: Appleton Estate Extra is a good choice
long strip of orange zest, for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: In a tall, heatproof glass or mug, dissolve the sugar or honey in a little hot coffee, then add the remaining ingredients. Stir with the cinnamon stick; garnish.
